content.description: Sit start with a right hand on the arete and a big left hand sidepull. From there, follow the features along the arete to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: Three pads would be ideal, but two will work fine. The landing is quite good except near the end.
content.location: It climbs the northeast arete of Cuz Koze.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand sidepull on the arete and a right hand edge on the face with poor feet. From there, establish good left footing, gain the arete, and follow to the boulder's apex to reach a featured end.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing has one rock that makes it uneven, otherwise it's very good.
content.location: It climbs the southeast arete of Cuz Koze.

content.description:
Sit start with a good left hand edge and a shallow right hand edge. From there, gain a good right hand edge, follow to a left hand edge, reach the lip, and mantel on top.

The problem shares a start hold with

Living In Parentheses

but does not use either arete.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work. One rock in the landing makes for an uneven affair.
content.location: It climbs the center of Cuz Koze's east face.
